heading: 1 Introduction
text:
website serves repository data management SOPs used
within Northwestern University Mesulam Center Cognitive Neurology &
Alzheimer’s Disease.

heading: 1.1 How to Use the Site
text:
Navigate SOPs Table contents left panel. Navigate chapters
within SOP right panel. Search specific SOP using search
bar located Table contents left panel.

heading: 1.1.1 Navigating Pages
text:
Navigate next SOP clicking next page button bottom 
text.Navigate previous SOP clicking previous page button 
bottom text.

heading: 2.1 Creating a New Data Request
text: Navigate ‘Mesulam Center Data Requests’ database REDCap.‘Data Collection’ tab left panel, select ‘Add/Edit Records’.Click large green ‘+ Add new record’ button. create new Record ID allow select ‘Data Request’ ‘Status’ Instruments.

heading: 2.6 Documenting the Data Request
text: purpose data documentation Data Request explain everything done. include:data pulled – databases used; specify data pulled via REDCap report, API, method.data pulled – variables pulled database.done data pulled – additional filtering sorting, adding comments/variables, calculations, etc.. documentation consists sentences short paragraphs, can entered directly Data Request Form Documentation textbox.B. documentation requires longer explanation, create word document paste link documentation Data Request Form Documentation textbox.

heading: 3.7 VLOOKUP
text:
VLOOKUP uses lookup value find certain matches within spreadsheet
another spreadsheet return user-specified value based match.
function takes form:=VLOOKUP(lookup_value, table_array, col_index_num, [range_lookup])begin using formula, determine looking 
want returned. four items need fill formula work:
lookup_value: value searching (single cell)
table_array: range search (typically column multiple columns)
col_index_num: column desired return value within table_array range
range_lookup: TRUE want locate approximate match lookup_value;
FALSE want locate exact match lookup_value
lookup_value: value searching (single cell)table_array: range search (typically column multiple columns)col_index_num: column desired return value within table_array rangerange_lookup: TRUE want locate approximate match lookup_value;
FALSE want locate exact match lookup_valueUse formula within first cell want returned value entered.Drag formula perform VLOOKUP cells specific column.following examples use two separate spreadsheets: one contains list
participant ids demographic information (az_demo); contains 
list participant id’s visit dates test scores (az_test).

next page, click ‘+ Create New Report’ tab.
